Description: Body and rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior: glazed black with reserved band; exterior: part of laurel wreath, to left, on rim; below, red-figure symposium scene; two youths reclining, facing left (head and shoulders of left-hand youth with trace of right arm, extended as if he were playing kottabos; head and torso of right-hand youth with right hand clasping his head, left hand at waist; both youths wearing wreaths with added white); relief contour except for forearm of left-hand youth; ancient repair hole on far left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0197) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (III i, p. 124, pl. 67, no. 8)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
